definition: lit. Dong Shi imitates Xi Shi's frown (idiom)/fig. to mimick sb's idiosyncrasies but make a fool of oneself
surname Dong
east/host (i.e. sitting on east side of guest)/landlord
surname Shi
to grant/to give/to bestow/to act/to carry out
effect/efficacy/to imitate
variant of 傚|效[xiao4]
variant of 效[xiao4]/to imitate
variant of 效[xiao4]
to scowl/to knit the brows

sentences.english: Most of the time our attempt to be creative is merely aping what we have seen elsewhere.
sentences.chinese: 大多时候，我们所尝试的创意，不过是东施效颦而已。

sentences.english: No one's idea of excellence in conduct is that people should do absolutely nothing but copy one another.
sentences.chinese: 没有一个人对于行为的优越表现是完全东施效颦。

definition: to try to draw a tiger but end up with a likeness of a dog (idiom)/to try to do sth overambitious and end up botching it
pinyin: hua4 hu3 bu4 cheng2 fan3 lei4 quan3

definition: to copy the way they walk in Handan (idiom)/slavishly copying others, one risks becoming a caricature
to try to draw a tiger but end up with a likeness of a dog (idiom)/to try to do sth overambitious and end up botching it
to pick up what others say (idiom); to pass off other people's opinions as one's own/to parrot
to make a fool of oneself/to make oneself a laughing stock
lit. drawing a tiger using a cat as a model (idiom); fig. to follow a model and get things more or less right but without capturing the spirit of the subject/uninspired imitation
to cut the feet to fit the shoes (idiom); to force sth to fit (as to a Procrustean bed)/impractical or inelegant solution
to buy a wooden box and return the pearls inside/to show poor judgment (idiom)
sensationalism/vulgar claptrap to please the crowds/playing to the gallery/demagogy
out of place/inappropriate/incongruous
lit. to draw a dipper with a gourd as a model (idiom)/fig. to copy slavishly
neither fish nor fowl/resembling nothing on earth
lit. draw legs on a snake (idiom); fig. to ruin the effect by adding sth superfluous/to overdo it
lit. a monkey wearing a hat (idiom)/fig. worthless person in imposing attire
the one who has retreated 50 steps laughs at the one who has retreated 100 steps (idiom)/the pot calls the kettle black
pinyin: wu3 shi2 bu4 xiao4 bai3 bu4

definition: lit. to use a dog's tail as a substitute for sable fur (idiom)/fig. a worthless sequel to a masterpiece
